metadata.title: CVE-2017-9779 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
OCaml compiler allows attackers to have unspecified impact via unknown vectors, a similar issue to CVE-2017-9772 "but with much less impact."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-9779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ocaml - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-base - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-base-nox - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-interp - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-man - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-nox - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-source - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: msalvatore> I believe this CVE has to do with unsafe handling of the TMPDIR environment variable in setuid binaries. Possible commits to resolve this are the same as those for CVE-2017-9772 binaries built with ocamlopt will need to be rebuilt after a system upgrade

criterions.comment: ocaml package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.05.0-10ubuntu1').
